text.p:
WAIFS AND STRAYS
OF
CELTIC TRADITION .

CRAIGNISH TALES
[Beurla le beagan Ghàidhlig na lùib]
MAR A FHUAIR MÌCHELL SCOT FIOS NA H - INID AS AN RÒIMHE AGUS A CHUIR E CRÌOCH AIR A ’ BHI ’ DOL AN SIN G ’ A SIREADH .

[Theirear an “ Inid Bheadaidh ” , ’ n uair a tha a ’ ghealach ùr beagan làithean an déidhe na Feille Brìde . Air dha so a bhith , thigeadh , mar a theìreadh na seann daoine , “ Earrach fád a tòin càisge ” . ]

HOW MICHAEL SCOT OBTAINED KNOWLEDGE OF SHROVE - TIDE FROM ROME , AND HOW HE CAUSED THE GOING THERE FOR THE PURPOSE OF ASCERTAINING THE KNOWLEDGE TO CEASE .
[Beurla]

THE GOOD HOUSEWIFE AND HER NIGHT LABOURS .
[Beurla]
A Bhean Tighe mhath ’ s Obair - Oidhche .

THE SKULL IN SADDELL CHURCH AND THE SERVING GIRL .
[Beurla]

TRADITIONS OF THE BRUCE .
RELATED BY PETER MACINTOSH , ESQ .
[Beurla le beagan Ghàidhlig na lùib]

THE QUESTIONS PUT BY FINN TO THE MAIDEN , AND HER ANSWERS .
[Beurla]

THE WAR DRESS OF THE CELT .
[Beurla]

THE ARMED HIGHLANDERS OF THE 17TH AND 18TH CENTURIES , WITH REMARKS ON THE FIGHTING POWER AND STRENGTH OF THE CLANS .
[Beurla]
